text: before I start writing I always know the
beginning in the end and all 9055 plot
twists I know the generalities about the
characters their age you know maybe a
little bit about their background their
family situation hi my name's Nicholas
Sparks and I am the author of the
longest ride people some me up in a word
they might say hey you know he writes
these books are have a lot of romantic
elements or oh he's guys right so sad
endings right real black and white but
the thing is you know those romantic
things don't work or those sad things
won't work unless you really evoke
everything else betrayal loss confusion
honesty integrity uncertainty and you
have to get all of those to make these
to work I think people have this I
perhaps have this idea that authors wake
up with a fully fleshed thought out
nuanced plot but it's not like that it
really is the seed of this idea so the
seeds have come from a lot of different
places in the past they've been family
events sometimes a character a person
that I know might inspire a character
sometimes it's a voice or a theme
sometimes it's an image to have an idea
that will work equally well as both a
novel and as a film is a very high bar
to reach the smallest idea can stump you
it worked would work great in the novel
and you get here and it's like this just
isn't going to work there's too much
introspection I can't film introspection
it's not going to work and so the the
seed will wither and die however the
moment I start writing the moment I have
the story that I think will work from
that point on literally from word one
it's only about the novel I don't think
about the film at all until really after
i'm done with it
